name: Meditation 1814: A meditation book for people who don't like books about meditation
description: Russell Brown is an acupuncturist and owner of Poke Acupuncture in Los Angeles. Brown's clinic and treatment style are based around the philosophy that one does not need to subscribe to woo-woo "Love & Light" jargon or faux Buddhist iconography to enjoy the benefits of Eastern medicine and wisdom, and that wisdom comes from all voices that speak authentically. For example, Angela Bassett, Donna Martin and Fairuza Balk in The Craft. With that in mind, Brown self-published a book; a non-jargony reintroduction to meditation for his Hollywood patients who often gripe that they "can't meditate" or that it's "too hard" with the intentions of breaking down some of the misconceptions people have about meditation and offer some stripped-down clarity for beginners and meditation civilians. The book became a love letter to finding your own inspirational voices. To some, Brown's might be unexpected—like Phylicia Rashad, Georgina Chapman and Mariah Carey in Precious—but they are the voices he turns to when asking for help from the universe. All these women are in his book--starting with Maya Angelou in an introduction named after one of Rhythm Nation 1814's vocal interludes--sketched with an iPad app called Sketch Guru, and voicing the words of Lao Tzu. Because great wisdom can come from even the most unconventional sources. ♥ 127 Pages - Paperback ♥ Self-Published by Russell Brown of Poke Acupuncture
